result.execSummary:
The defendant Micki Fredrick Nafzger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B", Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall undergo AODA assessment, with treatment and counseling as agent deems appropriate.
Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in and successfully complete evaluations, treatment & counseling deemed appropriate by Agent to include anger management and/or mental health.

Costs, surcharges & supervision fees to be paid during the term of probation as arranged by the agent. 
Submit to DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Micki Fredrick Nafzger
